poem:
"Digital Fears in the Schoolyard"

Within wafer-thin screens lies dark danger,  
teen heads bowed in digital prayer.  
Mismatched faces, real and fake,  
entrap, extort, hearts to break.  
Sirens of a foreign shore,
Whispers behind the classroom door.
The hush-hush talk of sextortion signs,
In the quiet rustle of lesson times.  
Teachers on watch, eyes all-seeing,
In crowded halls, silence screaming.
